content:
fyi: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/drush/releases/tag/1.3.1

backdrop-contrib/drush
A set of commands and boot class for Drush and Backdrop CMS. - backdrop-contrib/drush
...thanks @serundeputy :+1: I just tested things and the output of drush cset seems to be much more readable now:
Screen-Shot-2020-04-11-at-8.33.42-am.png
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) ++
(serundeputy)** thanks for all you do (Karma: 10)

Update Backdrop CMS sites via drush: https://twitter.com/howtobackdrop/status/1264238527837097984?s=20

See how to save time and update your Backdrop CMS sites w/ Drush: https://howtobackdrop.com/posts/update-backdrop-cms-cli-drush #backdropcms; #php; #drush;

- howtobackdrop (@howtobackdrop)

How did I not know about this already!? I've been doing it with Drupal for years, but every time there's a Backdrop update I do it all manually :face_palm: Thanks @Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) for the heads-up!
yeah; that was one of the firstish ones around in drushy drush backdrop :)

https://twitter.com/serundeputy/status/1265072009211510789?s=20

Hot off the presses try out the new `drush backdrop-subtheme-basis` or `drush sb` command to create a subtheme of Basis; currently `1.x-1.x` only: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/backdrop-drush-extension #backdropcms;

- Geoff (@serundeputy)

vid and text tutorial; https://twitter.com/howtobackdrop/status/1265385968175063041?s=20

Save time starting your Backdrop CMS projects create a subtheme in seconds: https://howtobackdrop.com/posts/drush-subtheme-basis-command #backdropcms; #drush; #cms;

- howtobackdrop (@howtobackdrop)
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) ++ for all the "how to Backdrop" videos and the recent drush sb command :+1:
(serundeputy)** leveled up! (Karma: 14)
Have just tested drush sb aka backdrop-subtheme-basis. Works fine, thanks!

Interesting that it puts in the full skin.css in the subtheme. Best approach for a quick start. Downside (or not): you don't get new features of the original skin.css (like once the unpublished indicator).
that feature requires the template.php file should i copy that over too? or allow for a flag? ... if you think so please file a FR on the backdrop-drush-extension queue thanks for using it!
Ah, didn't think of template.php! A flag would be nice! Before filing a PR for the drush command, I'm going to study Basis a bit more.
yeah; whatever you think would be improvements file an issue and we can add flags and improve the command

Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) said:

that feature requires the template.php file should i copy that over too? ...

Thinking about it, I guess template.php isn't needed in the subtheme in this case, it takes it from Basis.
I've been having trouble with upgrading Backdrop with Drush lately -- anyone else or is it just something with my server?

Seems to be related to this:

simplexml_load_file(): https:// wrapper is disabled in the server configuration by allow_url_fopen=0 backdrop_pm.drush.inc:199
Nevermind. I upgraded PHP and allow_url_fopen was disabled.
@klonos Did my steps to reproduce help with that Drush issue?
